citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC)
citeinfo.title: FOCI/SEBSCC Pribilof Island Acoustic Survey

descript.abstract: These data include acoustic backscatter at 38 and 120 kHz, CTD, surface temperature, salinity and fluorescence and bird counts along 4 transects near the Pribilof Islands surveyed in September 1994-1998. Also included were occasional corroboratory Method and Anchovy trawl and MOCNESS casts.
descript.purpose: This data set was collected to examine the relationship between the distribution of juvenile Pollock and environmental factors and plankton. By examining this relationship over multiple years and transects (day and night) we hope to better understand the source of Pollock year class strength in this Pollock nursery area.

idinfo.accconst: The data have been processed and require special access programs and software, contact Contributor

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
